subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0308_01C9D96D.3CF1EC00
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

"I'm not trying to say I know how a spirit could record on an analog record=
er, or if they can at all: my point was that it wasn't reasonable to assume=
 it could directly change the bits on digital media and wind up with anythi=
ng usable."

I wasn't trying to be a smart ass, just in case that is what y=
ou were thinking. I really wanted to know. Maybe I should have phrased it "=
Do you know how it would work with analog?" I wasn't like "Oh yeah...how bu=
t that??!!!" LOL!!!


"However, it may be that an EMF source strong enough =
to modify the signal would also effect all kinds of other things in the uni=
t, including the final media itself.  It would be interesting for someone t=
o determine what kind of external EMF is needed to induce or modify a signa=
l in the pre-digital phase of the recording circuitry, and what side effect=
s that would have.  Depending on the result, it could either reveal other w=
ays to detect spirit influence, or prove that no spirit influence (via EMF)=
 is happening."

Yes-it would be very interesting. I already know first han=
d that errant EMF can effect my digital recorder. I had this happen on just=
 our last case last weekend.

But tape would probably be different. It is t=
rue that we haven't had as many EVP's on analog as we get on our digitals. =
Maybe the ones we get on our analogs are actually disembodied voice, create=
d at a sound frequency we can't hear with our ears. I was just talking with=
 Jim about this very issue not too long ago.


  ----- Original Message ---=
-- 
  From: Rj 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2=
009 4:56 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.






        I=
'm not trying to say I know how a spirit could record on an analog recorder=
, or if they can at all: my point was that it wasn't reasonable to assume i=
t could directly change the bits on digital media and wind up with anything=
 usable.

        But, were I to conjecture, one might say that the air pre=
ssure of a voice is converted to a signal that modifies the magnetic proper=
ties of a tape.  And a line recording uses a signal, not from the mic, but =
from some other source, to do the same.  So if that signal were to be manip=
ulated via external EMF, it would change the final result on the tape.  

 =
       Since we are also assuming that digital recorders can pick up spirit=
s, then the simplest explanation is that that same up-front signal (before =
it gets digitized into bits) is also being manipulated.  And an EMF source =
could theoretically manipulate both the analog tape signal, and the digital=
 tape signal.

        However, it may be that an EMF source strong enough =
to modify the signal would also effect all kinds of other things in the uni=
t, including the final media itself.  It would be interesting for someone t=
o determine what kind of external EMF is needed to induce or modify a signa=
l in the pre-digital phase of the recording circuitry, and what side effect=
s that would have.  Depending on the result, it could either reveal other w=
ays to detect spirit influence, or prove that no spirit influence (via EMF)=
 is happening.



        --- On Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <april@abe=
rcrombieghostresearch.com> wrote:


          From: April Abercrombie <apri=
l@...>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have=
 a question.
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Date: Wednesda=
y, May 20, 2009, 3:37 PM


          =EF=BB=BF 

          Gotcha. Thanks. =
I do understand what you are saying. It does help to know these things.

  =
        Now how about with analog recorders. How would that work?

        =
    ----- Original Message ----- 
            From: Rj 
            To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
            Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 4:32 PM
  =
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.


                 =
 Your points seems to be that you can make it work without knowing how it w=
orks.  So we need to talk about what you mean by that.

                  W=
hen you use the microphone, you just speak, and let the recorder do the res=
t.  In this case, you are using the recorder without really knowing how it =
works.   If a spirit can manipulate the EMF field around the AtoD converter=
 (even without using the mic), then they should be able to do the same: jus=
t use it without knowing how it works: the recorder does the rest.  In neit=
her case do either of you need to know how it works, to get it to work. I a=
m not questioning this.

                  But, if they are going to change=
 the bits on the actual media themselves, then they must know how it works,=
 it order to get all those bit-things I mentioned right.  The recorder can'=
t "do the rest", because by changing the bits on the media themselves, they=
 are going completely around what the recorder does, and doing the details =
themselves.  And as I said, the details there are very technical, and inclu=
de things like converting their words into digital samples of groups of a s=
pecific number of bits in a specific format on specific places in specific =
orders with other specific other bits connected to them like file ownership=
 and dates and such.  It is the job, basically, of a computer, not a person=
.

                  If they are changing the bits on the media, then the r=
ecorder is not doing that.  They are no longer letting the recorder "do it"=
, like you or they would be if they just used it normally.  The reason you =
can "make it work" without understanding it, is because the recorder is doi=
ng the work for you.  If they are to change the media directly, then the re=
corder is no longer doing the work, and so they must understand all those d=
igital issues.

                  So that is the difference between being a=
ble to use it without understanding it, and not being able to use it.



  =
                --- On Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh=
 ostresearch. com> wrote:


                    From: April Abercrombie <ap=
ril@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
                    Subject: Re: [EVP-I=
TC] Re: I have a question.
                    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com=

                    Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 3:11 PM


             =
       =EF=BB=BF 

                    My point was that they don't need to=
 know how it works for it to work, like my analogy of when I speak into a m=
icrophone. I don't know how that works, but it does regardless.

          =
          "And consider this: if the spirit could make a normal tape record=
er record by messing with the EMF field near its mic, and it could make a d=
igital recorder record by messing with the EMF field neat its mic, why woul=
d the spirit even need to delve deeper into the digital world: what worked =
for the analog tape recorder, still works for the digital recorder, so why =
all the mindboggling extra effort for the same result?"

                  =
  That's what I'm sayin' LOL! They wouldn't need know and it would still wo=
rk.


                    "Maybe it's that you don't know how a digital rec=
order works?  It really doesn't just dump a lot of "digitals" into a nice n=
eat strip, akin to how an analog tape recorder does to tape.  To record dig=
itally takes many levels of processing, and a lot of careful digital choreo=
graphy on the final media. "

                    I don't know how it works=
. But here again, I don't have to know and it still works. I don't even kno=
w how exactly an analog recorder works either. I have no clue how my voice =
can be transferred and recorded via electronic means. But again, I don't ne=
ed to know to make it work.


                    But I see what you are sa=
ying and this does make sense:

                    "It is much more credib=
le for the signal to be manipulated near the AtoD converter (where EMF chan=
ges would have the most straighforward result) than in the digital media it=
self."

                    I never meant to insinuate exactly how it could=
 or couldn't work, only that true EVP is not created via sound waves in the=
 environment. It has to be electromagnetically generated. From this stateme=
nt is seems that's entirely verifiable.

                    EVP has been f=
ound on analog recordings. Would this also hold true for that kind of media=
?




                      ----- Original Message ----- 
                 =
     From: Rj 
                      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
        =
              Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 3:13 PM
                      S=
ubject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.


                            =
If the spirit doesn't know how to make it happen, then it's reasonable to a=
ssume that they are not making it happen.  It really does take a lot of kno=
w-how.

                            And consider this: if the spirit could =
make a normal tape recorder record by messing with the EMF field near its m=
ic, and it could make a digital recorder record by messing with the EMF fie=
ld neat its mic, why would the spirit even need to delve deeper into the di=
gital world: what worked for the analog tape recorder, still works for the =
digital recorder, so why all the mindboggling extra effort for the same res=
ult?

                            Maybe it's that you don't know how a digi=
tal recorder works?  It really doesn't just dump a lot of "digitals" into a=
 nice neat strip, akin to how an analog tape recorder does to tape.  To rec=
ord digitally takes many levels of processing, and a lot of careful digital=
 choreography on the final media.  \

                            --- On We=
d, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:=



                              From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombie=
gh ostresearch. com>
                              Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] R=
e: I have a question.
                              To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
 .com
                              Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 1:56 PM
=


                              =EF=BB=BF 

                              I=
 don't think they would have to know this to make it happen. We already kno=
w it happens and I bet that the spirit doesn't know exactly how it accompli=
shed it.

                              Sure, there could be another factor=
 that we just don't know about that makes EVP possible.

                  =
            "It is much more credible for the signal to be manipulated near=
 the AtoD converter (where EMF changes would have the most straighforward r=
esult) than in the digital media itself."

                              Ok=
 well-there you have it.

                                ----- Original Me=
ssage ----- 
                                From: Rj 
                    =
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                                S=
ent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 2:24 PM
                                Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.



                                =
Manipulating EMF is one thing.  But directly storing bits on a media is way=
 beyond that.  Bits are not stored in a continuous stream.  They are broken=
 into bytes (little packets) that is totally controlled by the processor an=
d software.  For Elvis to "encode directly" to the media, he would have to =
do what that software does to the digital signals coming in from the AtoD c=
onverter: he would have to group the bits into (for example) 16 little herd=
s each, decide on the specific bit interpretation scheme (2's complement?) =
,  find space on the media, update the media's dictionary of where there is=
 free space and where there isn't, link the herds together with some sort o=
f linked pointer, skip around the areas marked 'bad' on the media, update t=
hings like date/time modified and size, respect any kind of ownership permi=
ssions on the media, and so on.

                                It is much=
 more credible for the signal to be manipulated near the AtoD converter (wh=
ere EMF changes would have the most straighforward result) than in the digi=
tal media itself.

                                --- On Wed, 5/20/09, Apr=
il Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


            =
                    From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearc=
h. com>
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a=
 question.
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
   =
                             Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 1:05 PM


     =
                           =EF=BB=BF 

                                "Pro=
bably not "directly", since that would mean grandma would have to have quit=
e an understanding of digital encoding, including which bits mean what, whe=
n, and where."

                                Not necessarily- maybe it i=
s that just by trying to communicate through our equipment, it happens auto=
matically. They don't have to realize that they are manipulating the EMF to=
 make it occur, it just happens. It's the nature of being of pure energy.

=
                                ----- Original Message ----- 
             =
                   From: Rj 
                                To: EVP-ITC@ya=
hoogroups .com 
                                Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 20=
09 1:55 PM
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I hav=
e a question.



                                Probably not "directly", s=
ince that would mean grandma would have to have quite an understanding of d=
igital encoding, including which bits mean what, when, and where.  But even=
 on a digital recorder, there is still an analog element (the Analog to Dig=
ital converter) which takes the sound pressure waves, as represented by som=
e analog electronic detection element, and converts that into digital.  Tha=
t way, long departed uncle Ebenezer does not need to do anything digital.  =
Under this scenario, if sound is not being heard in the room, but is being =
induced into the circuitry, then it would be round about that AtoD converte=
r (assuming it isn't other just plain old noise in the digital elements).  =


                                Someone with more electronic know-how tha=
n me might be able to better pinpoint the area in the analog portion of tha=
t AtoD pipeline where it would be most likely it could be influenced by, sa=
y, an EM field, and that would also occur in a normal analog tape recorder.=


                                 
                                --- On =
Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrot=
e:


                                From: April Abercrombie <april@abercro=
mbiegh ostresearch. com>
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-=
ITC] Re: I have a question.
                                To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups .com
                                Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009=
, 12:29 PM



                                This is what I think true EVP=
 is Eric. Not and actual sound emitting a sound wave in the environment, bu=
t EMF manipulation in order to imprint the message directly to the recordin=
g media. It doesn't matter if it is analog or digital.

                   =
             If the sound that is recorded emitted a sound wave in the phys=
ical environment, then it is really a disembodied voice, and not true EVP.
=

                                ----- Original Message ----- 
            =
                    From: Eric VanDuzer 
                                To=
: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                                Sent: Wednesday=
, May 20, 2009 11:16 AM
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-I=
TC] Re: I have a question.


                                Actually that =
I would buy into  But the question I have when you say "tape" are you talki=
ng old analog tape or digi recording.  Here is the reason I believe it can =
be do "real-time".  As you all know we use electromagnetic Field detectors =
in field investigations.  If a spirit can manipulate that with to show that=
 they are there by giving off a EM field whose to say they can't manipulate=
 a magnetic strip of a tape or even the electronics in a Digi recorder to s=
peak in "real-time".



                                On Wed, May 20, 200=
9 at 1:01 PM, Kristin Morris <ckmorris95@sbcgloba l.net> wrote:





      =
                          Okay I have another one for you to think about.. =
I tape a session and review it later..  even a day later.  Upon review the =
message that comes over is about something that =E2=80=98just happened=E2=
=80=99 while I was reviewing or happened after taping?  Is it possible that=
 spirit can manipulate the recording AFTER recording has stopped or even ma=
nipulate the audio while reviewing?



                                An g=
ive you an example of this I was recording one day and I reviewed the audio=
 the next day.  While reviewing =E2=80=93 about half way through =E2=80=93 =
the message =E2=80=9CYour mother is calling=E2=80=9D was found.  I saved it=
 and moved on and within two seconds my mom called.  You say it is a coinci=
dence except that I hadn=E2=80=99t spoken to my mother in over a year.  Dur=
ing this same conversation with her =E2=80=93 we sorta made amends and I to=
ld her the story of the =E2=80=98secret=E2=80=99 I had found out about a fa=
mily member having a child out of wedlock in the late 1920s.  Quick backsto=
ry.. I found out about this out-of-wedlock birth through my genealogy resea=
rch and contacted spirit through the box and I was promptly told to keep it=
 secret and which I promised to do=E2=80=A6



                            =
    Well in this conversation with my mom after not speaking for a year I t=
old her what I had found out.  When the telephone conversation ended with m=
y mom=E2=80=A6 I was amazed that the recording had told me she would call r=
ight be fore she did =E2=80=93 even though the audio was recorded the previ=
ous day.  I proceeded to go back to reviewing the audio and the very first =
thing I heard was:  THAT WAS SUPPOSED TO BE A SECRET =E2=80=93 YOU LIED.


=

                                Maybe they can manipulate =E2=80=98real-ti=
me=E2=80=99 literally??? ?



                                k

                                2 different things h=
appening-that' s why. When you get EVP that everyone understands,  it is ou=
tward, in the environment. Not a communication through subconscious means.
=



                                EVP that people swear they hear, but noo=
ne else can make sense, may be a message to them via subconscious means. Th=
at isn't to say that ALL EVP's like this are true messages, I am sure alot =
are just matrixing.



                                But then that is how=
 the art of scrying starts-matrixing. Like the Rorschach tests. The images =
you matrix with those gives the psychologist an insight into your mind.



=
                                By gazing into a dark, reflective surface, =
you start to see cloudy images. At first, you will just be matrixing faces =
in the clouds and not getting much substance. Try it, you will see what I a=
m saying. With practice, you start to see clear, concise images.



       =
                         I think that is what happening with audio as well.=




                                We already know for a fact pareidolia c=
an occur in audio as well as visual stimulus.

ersonal EVPs through the traditional investigation way (not through a box o=
r anything of that matter) that all others have heard.

                   =

rcrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:



                                "If =
one person is not meant to hear it they won't hear it (I guess I am not qui=
te ready to believe that one right yet)." 



                             =
   I don't know for sure about that one either, but I am not ready to disco=
unt it either, especially since I stumbled across the possibility of audibl=
e scrying. But I am sure alot of people don't believe in scrying at all eit=
her.



                                What makes it a possibility to me i=
s that so many people are hearing things that are very personal, but stuff =
they would not have come up with on their own.

                                Fro=
m: Eric VanDuzer

.com

AM

stion.



                                I think that is the problem I am =
having though Jim.  When you say "work them over till you hear them"  to me=
 I should not have to work them over till I hear them.  Yes taking out the =
ambient and background noise is one thing.  But if you just keep on listeni=
ng to them with different enhancements you are bound to hear something (mat=
rixing).  If one person is not meant to hear it they won't hear it (I guess=
 I am not quite ready to believe that one right yet).  I think you all know=
 what I am getting at.  

                                On Tue, May 19, 2=
009 at 9:11 PM, James W. Hyslope <clockdryve@yahoo. com> wrote:



        =
                        Well, for myself...I don't "clean" them up to much =
because I really don't know HOW :) (well a little bit)Since I've only been =
at it for a couple weeks. BUT if you can clean up something to where you ca=
n FIND what was there to begin with "you have done no harm" I hear alot mor=
e than others I guess, and I haven't enhanced many of my evp's.*If anyone i=
s able to clean them up...I DO promise you will hear what I say is correct)=
Pretty BOLD statement, but if you are able to clean it up with better softw=
are (please do for others too) I will be more than happy to "listen" where =
I made a mistake...I can only LEARN from it :) I have done some DEEP enhanc=
ements to a few of my evp's...from the begining I could only hear clicks an=
d thumps.....but after messing with that area, eventually I would hear the =
true voices (and can tell if male or female...approximat e age) and underst=
and the mood also....these where extreamly modified, and I feel that I coul=
d NOT have added enough "simple" enhancements that would ADD a voice....ful=
l of emotion and distinct syllables :) And some just can't hear them for wh=
at ever reason be it equipment that is used to hear (pc-headphones- speaker=
s- ears) know one has the perfect match of all these things. Check out "Jim=
's RR-DR60 EVP's" in the files section....work them over till you hear them=
. I really can't do much more :)--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, Eric VanDu=
zer <evanduzer@.. .> wrote:
                                >

g things. I do clean
                                > up evps if I hear so=
mething and can't make it out do to ambient noise. So
                     =

 much
                                > enhancing "taint" the results? To m=
e the more enhancing you do the less
                                > conv=
incing it becomes. I hope noone finds this offensive, it is not meant
     =

 at it is that if you have to
                                > do so much =
enhancing to find anything, was there really something there to
           =

re is something there??

      <TD vAlign=3Dt=
op><BR>I'm not trying to say I know how a spirit could 
        record on a=
n analog recorder, or if they can at all: my point was that 
        it was=
n't reasonable to assume it could directly change the bits on 
        digi=
tal media and wind up with anything usable.<BR><BR>But, were I to 
        =
conjecture, one might say that the air pressure of a voice is converted 
  =
      to a signal that modifies the magnetic properties of a tape.  An=
d a 
        line recording uses a signal, not from the mic, but from some =
other 
        source, to do the same.  So if that signal were to be m=
anipulated 
        via external EMF, it would change the final result on t=
he tape.  
        <BR><BR>Since we are also assuming that digital rec=
orders can pick up 
        spirits, then the simplest explanation is that =
that same up-front signal 
        (before it gets digitized into bits) is =
also being manipulated.  
        And an EMF source could theoreticall=
y manipulate both the analog tape 
        signal, and the digital tape sig=
nal.<BR><BR>However, it may be that an 
        EMF source strong enough to=
 modify the signal would also effect all 
        kinds of other things in =
the unit, including the final media 
        itself.  It would be inte=
resting for someone to determine what kind 
        of external EMF is need=
ed to induce or modify a signal in the 
        pre-digital phase of the re=
cording circuitry, and what side effects that 
        would have.  De=
pending on the result, it could either reveal other 
        ways to detect=
 spirit influence, or prove that no spirit influence (via 
        EMF) is =
happening.<BR><BR><BR><BR>--- On <B>Wed, 5/20/09, April 
        Abercrombi=
e

                <TD vAlign=3Dtop>Your points seems to be that you can make=
 it 
                  work without knowing how it works.  So we need =
to talk 
                  about what you mean by that.<BR><BR>When you use=
 the 
                  microphone, you just speak, and let the recorder do=
 the 
                  rest.  In this case, you are using the recorde=
r without 
                  really knowing how it works.   If a spiri=
t can manipulate 
                  the EMF field around the AtoD converter=
 (even without using 
                  the mic), then they should be able =
to do the same: just use it 
                  without knowing how it works=
: the recorder does the 
                  rest.  In neither case do e=
ither of you need to know how 
                  it works, to get it to wor=
k. I am not questioning 
                  this.<BR><BR>But, if they are go=
ing to change the bits on the 
                  actual media themselves, t=
hen they must know how it works, it 
                  order to get all tho=
se bit-things I mentioned right.  The 
                  recorder can'=
t "do the rest", because by changing the bits on 
                  the med=
ia themselves, they are going completely around what 
                  the=
 recorder does, and doing the details themselves.  And 
              =
    as I said, the details there are very technical, and include 
         =
         things like converting their words into digital samples of 
      =
            groups of a specific number of bits in a specific format on 
  =
                specific places in specific orders with other specific othe=
r 
                  bits connected to them like file ownership and dates a=
nd 
                  such.  It is the job, basically, of a computer, =
not a 
                  person.<BR><BR>If they are changing the bits on th=
e media, 
                  then the recorder is not doing that.  They=
 are no longer 
                  letting the recorder "do it", like you or=
 they would be if 
                  they just used it normally.  The =
reason you can "make it 
                  work" without understanding it, =
is because the recorder is 
                  doing the work for you. =
 If they are to change the media 
                  directly, then the reco=
rder is no longer doing the work, and 
                  so they must under=
stand all those digital issues.<BR><BR>So 
                  that is the di=
fference between being able to use it without 
                  understand=
ing it, and not being able to use 
                  it.<BR><BR><BR><BR>---=
 On <B>Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie 
                  <I><april@aber=
crombiegh ostresearch. com></I></B>

                                <TD vAlign=3Dtop><BR>M=
anipulating EMF is one 
                                thing.  But di=
rectly storing bits on a 
                                media is way beyo=
nd that.  Bits are not 
                                stored in a co=
ntinuous stream.  They are 
                                broken int=
o bytes (little packets) that is 
                                totally c=
ontrolled by the processor and 
                                software.&n=
bsp; For Elvis to "encode directly" 
                                to the=
 media, he would have to do what that 
                                soft=
ware does to the digital signals coming in 
                               =
 from the AtoD converter: he would have to group 
                         =
       the bits into (for example) 16 little herds 
                       =
         each, decide on the specific bit interpretation 
                 =
               scheme (2's complement?) ,  find space on 
            =
                    the media, update the media's dictionary of 
          =
                      where there is free space and where there isn't, 
   =
                             link the herds together with some sort of link=
ed 
                                pointer, skip around the areas marked '=
bad' on 
                                the media, update things like date=
/time modified 
                                and size, respect any kind =
of ownership 
                                permissions on the media, and=
 so on.<BR><BR>It 
                                is much more credible fo=
r the signal to be 
                                manipulated near the At=
oD converter (where EMF 
                                changes would have=
 the most straighforward 
                                result) than in t=
he digital media 
                                itself.<BR><BR>--- On <B>=
Wed, 5/20/09, April

   <TD vAlign=3Dtop><BR>Probably not "directly", 
                         =
       since that would mean grandma would have to have 
                  =
              quite an understanding of digital encoding, 
                =
                including which bits mean what, when, and 
                =
                where.  But even on a digital recorder, 
             =
                   there is still an analog element (the Analog to 
       =
                         Digital converter) which takes the sound 
        =
                        pressure waves, as represented by some analog 
    =
                            electronic detection element, and converts that=
 
                                into digital.  That way, long depart=
ed
